Key aspects of the role is to be able to provide actionable insights in a timely, accurate and in a user friendly reporting. The role should take the time to understand intended audience needs and be able to close the loop by working with users on insights to action.Key Accountabilities:Facilitate development of mapping of shelf productivity across categories, across time and across stores.Extract data from multiple databases, summarize and present in a user-friendly formatWork across merchants, senior management, and divisional stakeholdersReview data, identify critical information, analyze, and develop hypothesis to make recommendations to broader audienceCommunicate and influence so shelf productivity insights are at core of decisions and ensure you are the fact based, independent and unbiased voice in all conversationsBuild analytical capabilities to grow the organizations knowledgeEnsure process deliverables are completed across timelines and teamsEngage in continuous development of the process for efficiencies and effectivenessManage cross-functional stakeholder needs both effectively and sensitivelyRelevant Experience:4-year college degree required. 2 years general retail experience a plus1-3 years' analytical & business intelligence reporting Experience in summarizing large amounts of data clearly and conciselyPrior work experience in category management will be a plusAdvanced SQL & Excel skillsProficient in Microsoft Office Suite, Power BI, Power Point, etc.High degree of initiative with strong planning skills; must be able to work independently and be a team playerStrong attention to detail and an ability to solve complex problemsBusiness Intelligence - W2 Requirement

title: Cloud Support Associate Engineer
job_description: This role is an opportunity for a hands-on engineer with a passion for Linux and cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and support the technical needs of customers leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have a passion for technology and an eagerness to learn, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.The role of a Cloud Support Associate Engineer at Canonical We regularly solve interesting, technical problems. From triaging complex Cloud environment issues, Linux kernel crashes we've never seen before to OS configuration issues and root cause analysis, we provide an expert level of support and satisfaction to our peer groups and customers.You will be accountable for delivering an outstanding technical support experience on the full cloud technical stack at Canonical. From problem qualification to full resolution, you will own and manage your cases. When needed, you will transfer your cases to your colleagues or involve senior engineers.Location: This is a remote role based in AMER or EMEA time zones.What your day will look likeWork from your remote home office and provide technical support for employees.Be available to take ownership of new cases via telephone, email and webAct as an internal customer advocate keeping them updated in a timely mannerEnsure that each support case owned by you is handled according to our Service Level Agreement (SLA) with the highest possible customer satisfaction by setting the right expectations and fulfilling your commitments.Contribute new knowledge base articles and maintain existing articles, ensuring shared knowledge and lessons learned are available to customers.Draft and distribute technical notices for internal and external communication.Prioritise your work in order to accomplish the most important and urgent tasks firstKeep on learning as our products and services grow and evolveUnderstanding Ubuntu development process to be able to set customer expectations correctly on timeline for a fix.Maintain regular communication and information exchange with the rest of the team, locally and remotelyIdentify and suggest any opportunities to provide a better serviceParticipate in a regular weekend working rotation.Background check requiredWhat are we looking for in you Bachelors or equivalent four year degree in a technical field from an accredited college or university. Preferable majors: Computer Science, MIS, Electrical Engineering, etc.Experience with Linux troubleshooting (collecting logs and stack traces, fine-tuning by editing configuration files)Experience with Linux server administrationStrong knowledge of Cloud computing concepts (provisioning, monitoring, orchestration, etc.)Knowledge or basic hands-on experience on 2 or more of:Virtualization / CloudContainersStorage technologiesNetworking (bonding, firewalling, bridging, switching, network file system tuning, MTU issues, etc.Programming fundamentals in any language (bash, Perl, Ruby, Javascript, C or C++, Go) Ability to learn quickly, thrive on change and handle the pressure of a customer facing jobStrong written and verbal English communication skillsAbility to travelAdditional skills that you might also bringExperience supporting virtualized environments (KVM, Virtual Box, VMWare)Experience with other open-source desktop technologiesActive contribution to open-source projects/forum/codeWhat we offer youYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annumAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveParental LeaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Health Care Economics Analyst I/II
job_description: Blue Cross of Idaho has an exciting opportunity for a Healthcare Economics Analyst. This individual will use advanced statistical and computational methodologies to deliver insights and identify strategic opportunities to improve the cost and quality of healthcare. Analyzes large data sets from various sources to evaluate trends and create models.We Are Looking For a Candidate WithHealthcare Economics Analyst I:Education: Bachelor’s Degree Math, Statistics, Data Science, Actuarial, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, Accounting, or related field; or equivalent work experience (Two years’ relevant work experience is equivalent to one-year college)Healthcare Economics Analyst IIExperience: 2 years’ data analysis experience in any of the following areas: Mathematics, Statistics, Data Science, Actuarial, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, or AccountingEducation: Bachelor’s Degree Math, Statistics, Data Science, Actuarial, Economics, Finance, Engineering, Computer Science, Accounting, or related field; or equivalent work experience (Two years’ relevant work experience is equivalent to one-year college)What a Day Would Look LikeExamine and identify data patterns and trends to help answer business questions and improve decision making.Perform analytic research, experience studies, and statistical analyses and calculations.Research and apply knowledge of existing and emerging statistical and data science principles, theories, and techniques.Presenting and explaining analysis to varied internal and external customers.Make proficient use of spreadsheets (Excel), programming languages (SQL, R, Python, etc.), and other relevant software to capture and manipulate data and complete modeling tasks.Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.Reasonable accommodationsTo perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

title: Junior Windows Engineer
job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.We are looking for a Windows Engineer to join our multi-tenant hosting team. You’ll be responsible for the design, implementation, and health of our domain architecture including but not limited to Active Directory, authentication technologies, and DNS. As part of Epic's hosting team, you'll enjoy opportunities to keep abreast of the latest technologies and work collaboratively with experts in a variety of knowledge areas to ensure a robust and secure environment that forms the foundation of our hosting service. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. title: Utilities Engineer
job_description: The Sacyr Group has over 30 years of experience and annual revenues of $4.5 billion and a backlog close to $50 billion.We have strong presence in five continents and have 45,000 employees capable of turning challenges into opportunities. Sacyr is committed to a future that seeks to improve our cities, enhance the environment and better daily lives.Sacyr’s core strategy is driven by our Public Private Partnership (P3) company, Sacyr Concesiones, S.L., one of the world’s leading P3 infrastructure developers with a highly diversified and globally distributed asset portfolio. Sacyr Infrastructure USA LLC is the American brand under which Sacyr Concesiones, S.L. operates in the U.S.Public-Private Partnership infrastructure delivery has been proven to be one of the most efficient ways to improve infrastructure stock in different countries, where a private investor works together with a Public Authority in order to finance, design, build and operate public infrastructure.University of Idaho’s Utility System is Sacyr’s first ever investment in North America. Sacyr manages the Concessionaire, a private entity with whom the University has signed a 50-year lease under which it operates and maintains the University’s Utility System at their Moscow, ID campus.The Concessionaire is also responsible for the delivery of major repairs, capital replacements, and expansions to allow the University to meet their needs over the term.Position SummarySacyr Infrastructure USA is looking for a Project Coordinator to support and oversee operations. The person will report to the CEO, Sacyr Plenary Utility Partners Idaho LLC.Duties and Responsibilities:To support on site-supervision and monitoring the daily operations and maintenance provided by the Concessionaire’s local contractor on-campus, as well as acting as close liaison with the University’s leadership.On-site supervision and monitoring of the delivery of major repairs, replacements, and expansions of the Utility System.Assistance reviewing any documents submitted to the Concessionaire (operations, financial, insurance) by different third parties and preparing deliverables to the University, including utility fee forecasts, capital planning, and other reporting needs (internal and external).Participation in the Concessionaire’s Board of Directors, including assistance with the preparation of board reports.Assistance identifying new bidding opportunities and supporting the Business Development team with the submission.RequirementsAt least 2/3 years of experience as a Project Coordinator or similar roleBSc in Mechanical Engineering. Background in business administration is recommended.Preferable previous experience at the University of IdahoInterest in the infrastructure sector (energy, water, social and transportation)High proficiency in Excel and strong comfort working with numbers.Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.Strong communication and interpersonal skills.Comfort working with a team and independently, self-motivated.A desire to further develop skills in project management, and project finance.Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Teams, Excel, Word and Power Point)Fluency in Spanish is a plus.

title: 35F Intelligence Analyst
job_description: On the battlefield, success depends on accurate and timely intel. As an Army National Guard Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in the interpretation and exploitation of information gathered from or about the threat. Intelligence Analysts provide Guard personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas, and use information derived from all intelligence disciplines to determine changes in enemy capabilities, vulnerabilities, and probable courses of action. You’ll gain Military Intelligence training, education, and a security clearance that could open doors to rewarding career opportunities with other intelligence agencies.Specific duties of the Intelligence Analyst may include: preparing all-source intelligence products; providing Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization support; processing incoming reports and messages; determining the significance and reliability of incoming information; establishing and maintaining systematic, cross-referencing intelligence records and files; integrating incoming information with current intelligence holdings; and preparing and maintaining enemy situational graphics.Job DutiesPreparing all-source intelligence products to support the combat commanderAssessing the significance and reliability of incoming intelligence collectionEstablishing and maintaining systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and filesSome Of The Skills You’ll LearnCritical thinkingThe ability to use sophisticated mapping tools, intelligence networks, and systems to identify the evolving threat on the battlefieldGather information utilizing premier digital and analytical tools to create products for the CommanderHelpful SkillsAnalytical thinking; gathering information, and understanding of relevancyInterest in reading maps and chartsMore than any other branch of service, the Army National Guard offers a wide range of intelligence-related positions. Through your training, you will develop skills and experience to create opportunities for a civilian career with federal agencies like the National Security Agency.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to learn. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance and certifications. Job training for an Intelligence Analyst consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 13 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practice in intelligence gathering. You’ll learn in the classroom and gain experience in the field. Completion of your initial entry training in the Army National Guard could also lead to additional college credit.
Industries: Government Relations Services, International Affairs, and Security and Investigations

title: Security Engineer
job_description: *Security Engineer (*Meridian, ID*)Since 1993, Right! Systems, Inc. has been providing exceptional solutions and uncommon expertise to help our customers achieve lasting benefits. (RSI) is seeking a talented individual for the role of Security Engineer. This is a full-time position.You will be working on a team of highly skilled technicians and engineers across a wide range of disciplines, representing solutions from Cisco, Palo Alto, Fortinet, Aruba and more. Your role is to ensure that industry best practices and methodologies are applied to the deployment, integration, and operational support of our customer environments.This role is NOT remote - candidates must live in the service area and be able to report to the Meridian office as needed. This role reports the Engineering Manager.Duties and ResponsibilitiesBuild and maintain a deep technical understanding of network technologies, including security architecture, firewalls, identity management, edge and end-user security platforms security management tools, and other related productsWork on detailed and complex projects integrating multiple technologies across multiple disciplines as part of a team of engineersWork on-site or remotely to diagnose and resolve both emergency and chronic problems related to availability, security, performance, connectivity, and overall functionalityAttend or participate in various product training sessions and classes in order to broaden your skillset while maintaining RSI’s vendor relationshipsMeet with customers to discuss and outline new technologies that improve and enhance their current environmentsOther work-related duties as assignedRequirements5+ years of equivalent network technology experienceCisco CCNP Security or CCIE Security, Palo Alto Networks PCNSE, or demonstrable experience level requiredHands on experience deploying and designing complex network security solutionsHands on experience with PAN firewalls requiredUnderstanding of security frameworks and compliance requirements for regulated industries requiredHands on experience with Cisco Firepower firewalls preferredPalo Alto Networks PCNSE highly preferredHands on experience with Palo Alto Networks Prisma, Panorama, and PAN SDWAN solutions preferredStrong design and troubleshooting skills for firewalls requiredHands on experience with Fortinet firewalls or Fortinet NSE certification preferredExperience with network segmentation and datacenter security best practicesExperience with design and deployment of Cisco ISE or Aruba ClearPass highly preferredPervious experience as a consultant desiredDeep understanding and experience with advanced routing and switching protocolsStrong interpersonal, written and oral communication skillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsHighly self-motivated, directed and organized with attention to detail and accuracyAbility to effectively prioritize tasks in a fast-paced scenarioStrong customer service orientationExperience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environmentProficiency in MS Office Suite (Excel, Outlook, Word)Experience in CRM databasesWork schedule is typically Monday through Friday from 8am to 5pm with the ability to travel 30% of the time during weekdays. Occasional weekend work may be required.Candidate must have a valid Driver’s license.Compensation/BenefitsBase pay DOERSI offers competitive salary, comprehensive benefits package that includes group medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), life insurance/LTD, and PTO (Paid Time Off) for vacation, sick and personal leave needs.Work with enterprise to mid-sized organizations and Fortune 1000 and Fortune 500 Companies, where you are considered a value-added resource to include training, certifications and career development opportunities.Right! title: Sr Data Engineer
job_description: As the nation's largest community credit union, we begin every day focused on delivering superior financial products and services for our 1.3 million members and more than $30 billion in managed assets. Our work has an economic impact as we support our members' financial goals. We are unapologetic about being devoted to our members and the communities we serve. Our business is guided by our people helping people philosophy – which includes our team members.BECU has been in business for more than 85 years, driven by unwavering core values and a dedication to improving the communities we serve. While we have a rich history, the future of our company, accelerated by business and technology transformation, is even brighter. There's never been a better time to work for BECU.To learn more visit becu.org/careers.PAY RANGEThe Target Pay Range for this position is $134,200-$164,000 annually. The full Pay Range is $104,200-$194,000 annually. At BECU, compensation decisions are determined using factors such as relevant job-related skills, experience, and education or training. Should an offer for employment be made, we will consider individual qualifications. In addition to your salary, compensation incentives are available for the hired applicant. Incentives are performance based and targets vary by role.BenefitsEmployees and their eligible family members have access to a wide array of employee benefits, such as medical, dental, vision and life insurance coverage. Employees have access to disability and AD&D insurance. We also offer health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts, as well as health savings accounts, to eligible employees. Employees are able to enroll in our company’s 401k plan and employer-funded retirement plan. Newly hired employees accrue 6.16 hours of paid time off (PTO) on a per pay period basis based on hours worked (up to a maximum of 160 PTO hours per year) and receive ten paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Additional details regarding BECU Benefits can be found here.Impact You'll MakeIn this dynamic role as a Senior Data Engineer, you’ll be at the forefront of shaping and implementing cutting-edge data solutions. Your expertise will drive the creation of enterprise-class data pipelines, shaping the way data is handled, analyzed, and utilized. You'll mentor and collaborate with a talented team, influencing both technical and strategic decisions. By designing innovative data models and workflows, you'll play a key role in solving complex business problems and contribute significantly to our system and service architecture. Here, your skills won’t just fill a role, they’ll power our mission and make a lasting impact.To join our dynamic team, we require candidates to be residents of WA, OR, ID, AZ, TX, GA, or SC. If you call any of these states home, you're in luck! We offer the flexibility of remote work for residents in these locations, allowing you to contribute from the comfort of your own home.What You'll Do Data Design Mastery: Craft and develop multi-tier, complex systems including analysis, coding, and documentation. Mentorship and Leadership: Guide and support data engineering teams, enhancing business data processes and systems. Technical Communication: Effectively present technical concepts to the engineering community. Workflow Innovation: Design and execute intricate workflows to meet technical data requirements. Prototype Development: Create and implement prototypes and proofs of concept, integrating your deep understanding of data workflow design. Policy Implementation: Apply metadata management and master data strategies within data workflows. Team Coordination: Mentor and organize teams for effective development and testing of data system components. Technology Vision: Collaborate in designing your team's technology roadmap. Skill Development: Assist in developing a training plan for advanced data engineering skills. Quality Champion: Uphold and enhance code quality standards. Programming languages: Java, Pyspark, Python and Open Source RDBMS and NoSQL databases and Cloud based data warehousing services such as Redshift and Snowflake.Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience. At least 5 years of data engineering experience. Proficiency in Python, PySpark Scala, Java, SQL, Airflow, dbt. Solid experience with cloud technologies (Azure, AWS, GCP). Skilled in modern data platforms (Azure Synapse, Databricks, Redshift, Big Query, Snowflake). Expertise in ETL/ELT, SQL, and cloud data integration tools (Azure Data Factory, AWS Glue, Informatica, etc.). Proven experience in SQL, data modeling, data warehousing, and data analysis. Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery systems (Azure DevOps, GitHub). Familiarity with git, code reviews, pull requests, and branching standards (Git Flow or Trunk-Based Development). Experience in Test Driven Development, including unit, integration, and performance/load testing. Demonstrated ability to develop scalable data solutions and stay updated with emerging technologies. Proven experience leading and collaborating in a team environment throughout the SDLC.Preferred Qualifications Experience in master data (MDM), metadata, and data governance tools (Alation, Erwin, Collibra, Azure Purview). Experience in banking domain but not mandatory.EEO StatementBECU is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status.
Industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Non-profit Organizations

title: Cloud Support Engineer
job_description: This role is an opportunity for a hands-on engineer with a passion for Linux and cloud technologies to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products.If you have an affinity for open source development and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.The role of a Cloud Support Engineer at Canonical We regularly solve interesting, technical problems. From triaging complex Cloud environment issues, Linux kernel crashes we've never seen before to OS configuration issues and root cause analysis, we provide an expert level of support and satisfaction to our peer groups and customers.We are rapidly expanding and are looking for talented problem solvers with a passion for working on the next generation of Ubuntu solutions for our customers.Location: This is a globally remote role, unless specified otherwise.What your day will look likeInvestigate issues reported by customers by researching and escalating issues Work to resolve complex customer problems related to Canonical's portfolio of products.Ownership of results: Ensure that each support case owned by you is handled according to our Service Level Agreement (SLA) with the highest possible customer satisfaction by setting the right expectations and fulfilling your commitments.Engage directly with customers and work collaboratively by phone, ticketing system, and remote sessions to resolve their issues.Participate in a regular weekend working rotation.Contribute new knowledge base articles and maintain existing articles, ensuring shared knowledge and lessons learned are available to customers.Understanding Ubuntu development process to be able to set customer expectations correctly on timeline for a fix.Background check requiredWhat are we looking for in you Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English.Hands-on and extensive working experience in supporting Linux systems including 3 or more of:Virtualization / Cloud - primarily using KVM or OpenStack.Containers - especially with Docker, LXD/LXC, or Kubernetes.Storage technologies - block, object and network.Networking (bonding, firewalling, bridging, switching, network file system tuning, MTU issues, etc.).Cloud computing expertise in provisioning, monitoring, orchestration, etc.Advanced troubleshooting experience:Linux integration with other environments (authentication/directory services, network file systems, etc.).Ability to navigate effectively stack traces and logs, and advise on next steps.Solid understanding of OS and Application level bugs and when to escalate to the correct team.Programming fundamentals in any language.Extensive Customer support experience is key:Customer needs are top priority.Communicate professionally, emphatically, clearly and set the right expectations.Ability to travel.What we offer youYour base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits below, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annumAnnual compensation reviewRecognition rewardsAnnual holiday leaveParental LeaveEmployee Assistance ProgrammeOpportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company eventsAbout CanonicalCanonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.Canonical is an equal opportunity employerWe are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Senior Portfolio Analyst - Climate and ESG
job_description: Our firm is an independent Registered Investment Advisor dedicated to providing clients with sustainable investment management, personalized financial planning, and innovative strategies that deliver social and environmental impact. We work with clients who seek to use their resources to advance social justice and protect the environment, and we provide aligned investment strategies designed to meet both financial and impact objectives. We are fee-only, employee-owned, woman-led, and a certified B Corp. As a firm, we aim to create a better world for people and the planet, and we have a clear set of values to support that work. Our team, our strategies and our clients are all aligned in our intention and share this passion. We are a small team, so each role is uniquely important at our firm, and we never hesitate to support each other.We are looking for an experienced Portfolio Analyst to propel our sustainability-focused investment strategies to the next level. In this critical role, you will implement and advance our proprietary portfolio disciplines, with a special focus on integrating climate risks and opportunities into our actively managed fundamental public equity strategies. The role offers an opportunity to join our young and fast-growing firm and includes significant opportunities for thought leadership, potential firm ownership down the road, and being part of a team that’s creating real impact around climate change and social justice.As a successful candidate, you are eager to put to work your exceptional analytical skills, accumulated knowledge around both the capital markets and the environment, and strong ability to communicate your ideas and analysis. You are curious about global events and trends, passionate about uncovering promising and impactful themes, and driven to use your expertise to make a difference in the world, particularly around mitigating the impacts of climate change.KEY RESPONSIBILITIESIn the role of Senior Portfolio Analyst, you will:Analyze public equities across multiple sectors, integrating climate and other ESG drivers into fundamental analysis using a growth-at-a-reasonable-price (GARP) methodologyGenerate new investment ideas that are a thematic fit and have strong growth potentialLead research team in understanding and applying climate-related risks and opportunities, and integrating those into portfolio construction, primarily in equitiesHelp team develop climate-related strategies across other asset classes, with opportunity to lead launch of new strategies and disciplinesPrepare written reports and recommendations for internal team as well as external communications with clientsHelp create and maintain equity and balanced account models, using Black Diamond portfolio reporting softwareAssist with strategy around climate-focused shareholder engagementsAdvise on measuring and managing the carbon footprint of our firm’s internal operationsWHAT IT TAKES4+ years’ experience in analyzing securities and/or managing portfolios, preferably with a focus on ESG, sustainable and/or impact investment strategies required; 8+ years preferredExceptional analytical skills, demonstrated understanding of fundamental research and valuation methodologiesExcellent writing and verbal communication skills; confidence and ability to express ideas and advocate for recommendationsBachelor’s degree required; MBA or advanced degree in finance a plusCFA strongly preferred; may consider individuals that are somewhere on their CFA journeySeries 65 (may be obtained within 6 months as a condition of employment)Strong working knowledge of climate-focused frameworks and initiatives for investors (e.g., Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures, Science-Based Targets Initiative, Net Zero Asset Managers Initiative)A long-term perspective about the markets combined with an understanding of the urgency around decarbonization, climate resilience, and environmental sustainabilityProficiency with Eikon/Workspace, Bloomberg, Factset or similarFamiliarity with additional financial industry software and systems, including custodial platforms (Schwab), portfolio reporting (Black Diamond/Advent) and CRM software (Redtail)Ability to work as part of a team in a fun, hardworking, and progressive firmA commitment to ongoing professional developmentTHE BENEFITSWe offer a competitive compensation package that includes a base salary plus bonus, 401k with company match, health insurance including dental and vision coverage, paid and volunteer time off, and opportunities for training and career growth.EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITYOur firm provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local law.Moreover, we believe that diversity of perspectives, experiences, and talents strengthens our organization and contributes to a thriving and innovative work environment. We encourage individuals from all backgrounds and identities to apply and welcome applications from women, people of color, and other groups traditionally underrepresented in finance.

title: Windows Engineer
job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.We are looking for a Windows Engineer to join our multi-tenant hosting team. You’ll be responsible for the design, implementation, and health of our domain architecture including but not limited to Active Directory, authentication technologies, and DNS. As part of Epic's hosting team, you'll enjoy opportunities to keep abreast of the latest technologies and work collaboratively with experts in a variety of knowledge areas to ensure a robust and secure environment that forms the foundation of our hosting service. Learn more about the team at https //careers.epic.com/Jobs/Hosting.Desired Skills And Knowledge Areas Expertise in Active Directory design and maintenance Expertise in automation using scripting tools like Powershell Experience with AD trusts and replication Experience administering Azure Active Directory and Azure Active Directory Connect Experience with deployment and troubleshooting of DNS & DHCP Knowledge of configuration management tools like Puppet, Chef, or Ansible Knowledge of Active Directory Federation Services Knowledge of authentication technologies Kerberos, LDAP, SAMLMore than just important work.Epic is located in Madison, Wisconsin, a city regularly ranked as one of America's best places to live. Epic's environment is one of continuous learning; you'll have access to opportunities to expand your skill set and share your knowledge with others. We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.This position features three different starting points, based upon prior experience.Junior Windows Engineer requires 0-2 years prior experienceWindows Engineer requires 2-5 years prior experienceSenior Windows Engineer requires 5+ years prior experienceAdditional RequirementsA history of academic and professional successEligibility to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship.Troubleshooting skills and good customer service are requiredRelocation to the Madison, WI, area (reimbursed)Available to work 1st, 2nd, or 3rd shiftCOVID-19 vaccinationAs a member of the Hosting team at Epic you'll be responsible for the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of Epic Hosting. Those responsibilities include:Following policies and procedures and escalating when policies or procedures are not followedEscalating potential security incidents and providing relevant informationMeeting all security responsibilities defined in policies and procedures

title: Salesforce Developer and Data Integration Specialist
job_description: About This OpportunityAs a Salesforce Developer and Data Integration Specialist, you will be responsible for helping the sales team to grow revenue by bringing our sales processes to life through automation, data connection, and insights. This individual will be essential to ensuring data accuracy, optimizing workflow efficiency, and enabling a smooth transfer of information between different platforms. The Salesforce Developer & Data Integration Specialist will collaborate with various teams, including sales, marketing, and data engineering, to gather business requirements and architect, implement, and maintain processes and solutions that enhance our overall business performance. As we continue to evolve and live our Orion values, we are looking for someone to grow with us.We can consider candidates for this position who are able to accommodate a hybrid work schedule and are close to one of our following offices: Omaha, NE, Berwyn, PA, Sacramento, CA, Hebron, KY, Chandler, AZ, Provo, UT, or Idaho Falls, ID.In This Role, You'll Get ToWork closely with the Salesforce (including lead routing, notifications, tasks, and workflow tools)Build or work with others to build BI dashboards to help the business gain insights into its performanceImplement security measures and adhere to compliance standards to safeguard sensitive information during integration and data transfer processesCreate comprehensive documentation of current systems and configurations, integration processes, and best practices, and provide training to end-users and other stakeholders to enable smooth adoption and usage of integrated systemsCollaborate with cross-functional teams, including business users, business analysts, sales, marketing, senior management, and data engineering, to gather requirements, understand needs, and communicate project progress effectivelyStay up to date with the latest Salesforce features, releases, and industry best practices to identify, document, and communicate opportunities for system enhancements and continuously improve integration performance We're Looking With Talent WithAt least 3 years related experienceAdvanced knowledge of Salesforce Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud, and Service CloudExperience working directly with sales leadership to solve complex technical challenges and drive improvements in sales processSalesforce Certifications:Salesforce Certified Platform Developer I (required)Salesforce Certified Platform and processesPreferred experience with Pardot (Account Engagement)Preferred experience with MulesoftPreferred experience with BI tools like Microsoft BI, Tableau, or QuickSightPreferred knowledge of sales and marketing processes and best practicesPreferred experience in financial services, ideally wealth managementObtain Orion Industry CertificationOwns and manages relationships with stakeholders directly and work effectively with people at all levels in an organizationSalary Range$69,723.00 - $105,276.00The pay listed in this posting indicates the estimated pay at the time of this posting; We are creating a welcoming environment where everyone is respected, valued, and heard. Our willingness to disrupt ourselves, and the industry ensures we stay ahead of client expectations. Thinking differently is in our DNA – we innovate, push boundaries, reject the status quo, and relentlessly pursue transformative outcomes. It is our collective will to win that drives Orion’s success and powers success for our clients and everyone at Orion.

title: 35F Intelligence Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionJob DescriptionOn the battlefield, success depends on accurate and timely intel. As an Army National Guard Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in the interpretation and exploitation of information gathered from or about the threat. Intelligence Analysts provide Guard personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas, and use information derived from all intelligence disciplines to determine changes in enemy capabilities, vulnerabilities, and probable courses of action. You'll gain Military Intelligence training, education, and a security clearance that could open doors to rewarding career opportunities with other intelligence agencies.Specific duties of the Intelligence Analyst may include: preparing all-source intelligence products; providing Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization support; processing incoming reports and messages; determining the significance and reliability of incoming information; establishing and maintaining systematic, cross-referencing intelligence records and files; integrating incoming information with current intelligence holdings; and preparing and maintaining enemy situational graphics.Job DutiesPreparing all-source intelligence products to support the combat commanderAssessing the significance and reliability of incoming intelligence collectionEstablishing and maintaining systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and filesSome Of The Skills You'll LearnCritical thinkingThe ability to use sophisticated mapping tools, intelligence networks, and systems to identify the evolving threat on the battlefieldGather information utilizing premier digital and analytical tools to create products for the CommanderHelpful SkillsAnalytical thinking; gathering information, and understanding of relevancyInterest in reading maps and chartsMore than any other branch of service, the Army National Guard offers a wide range of intelligence-related positions. Through your training, you will develop skills and experience to create opportunities for a civilian career with federal agencies like the National Security Agency.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to learn. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance and certifications. Job training for an Intelligence Analyst consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 13 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practice in intelligence gathering. You'll learn in the classroom and gain experience in the field. Completion of your initial entry training in the Army National Guard could also lead to additional college credit.Benefits/RequirementsBenefitsPaid trainingEarn a security clearanceA monthly paycheckMontgomery GI BillFederal and State tuition assistanceRetirement benefits for part-time serviceLow-cost life insurance (up to $400,000 in coverage)401(k)-type savings planStudent Loan Repayment Program (up to $50,000, for existing loans)Health care benefits availableVA home loansBonuses, if applicableMost non-prior service candidates will initially earn between $200 and $250 per drill weekend, subject to change.RequirementsMilitary enlistment in the Army National GuardMust be at least a junior in high school, or have a high school diploma or GED certificateMust be between the ages of 17 and 35Must be able to pass a physical exam and meet legal and moral standardsMust meet citizenship requirements (see NATIONALGUARD.com for details)Requires military enlistment. Programs and benefits are subject to change. Ask your Army National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information. Actual MOS assignment may depend on MOS availability.Other Job InformationJob ID: 2302ZIP Code: 83605Job Category: IntelligenceAge Requirements: Must be between the ages of 17 and 35 researcher

title: Sales Operations Business Analyst
job_description: At Iron Mountain we know that work, when done well, makes a positive impact for our customers, our employees, and our planet. That’s why we need smart, committed people to join us. Whether you’re looking to start your career or make a change, talk to us and see how you can elevate the power of your work at Iron Mountain.We provide expert, sustainable solutions in records and information management, digital transformation services, data centers, asset lifecycle management, and fine art storage, handling, and logistics. We proudly partner every day with our 225,000 customers around the world to preserve their invaluable artifacts, extract more from their inventory, and protect their data privacy in innovative and socially responsible ways.Are you curious about being part of our growth stor y while evolving your skills in a culture that will welcome your unique contributions? If so, let's start the conversation.Responsibilities:This position will provide valuable support to the Sales Leadership team with reporting, analytics, performance assessments, dashboards, commissions, as well as a multitude of other routine and ad hoc reports and projects. It will also act as a secondary resource to help interface with several assigned sales segments/product lines. This individual must work collaboratively with sales leadership, managers and sales reps. The position is expected to increase sales effectiveness, sales productivity and process compliance within those regions by means of consulting with the sales force and implementing best practice sales & operational processes. In addition to supporting the sales segment/product line sales force, the position will also include certain responsibilities for specific subject matter areas and related continuous improvement project responsibilities. quota management, experience with SalesForce)Advanced proficiency in the Google Suite (including Google DataStudio) , SalesForce.com, Tableau, and BI/DatawarehousesResults oriented/ Problem solving title: Technical Solutions Engineer
job_description: Please note that this position is based on our campus in Madison, WI, and requires relocation to the area. We recruit nationally and provide financial relocation assistance.Problem-solving with a purpose.As a Technical Solutions Engineer at Epic, you’ll work on software that impacts 305 million patients around the world. Alongside customer counterparts, you’ll tackle mission-critical and complex problems – we’re way beyond “turn it off and on again” issues. You’ll need to diagnose the problem, identify a solution, and manage the implementation of the solution, sometimes across multiple physical locations and stakeholders. Learn more about our team at https //careers.epic.com/Jobs/Technical-Solutions-Engineer.Test the limits of your brain for the most innovative health systems on the planet.The top-ranked health systems in U.S. News and World Report are Epic customers. Our community includes major systems like the Mayo Clinic, Johns Hopkins, Cleveland Clinic, and Kaiser Permanente, as well as leading academic medical centers at the University of Wisconsin, University of Michigan, University of California, University of Texas, The Ohio State University, and many more.Experience our state-of-the-art campus, eat delicious food, and travel the world.We don’t believe in cubicles. (Well, we believe they exist, but…) Our uniquely themed campus was designed to heighten your ability to get stuff done in your office, a conference room, or by the fireplace in a comfy chair. For lunch, visit King’s Cross or Cassiopeia for a wide array of meal options, or go to one of our smaller, themed bistros, featuring wood-rotisserie, pan-Asian, and Latin-inspired cuisine. All meals are restaurant-quality but cost only a few dollars, and they’re prepared by a team comprised of kitchen talent from restaurants around the country. And, after five years here, you’ll earn a four-week sabbatical anywhere in the world. Staff have kayaked in Patagonia, attended a Beyoncé concert in Ireland, built a library in Tanzania, and run a marathon in Antarctica.Live affordably in a city known for its rising tech talent.Epic is located just outside Madison, Wisconsin, which is the second fastest growing market for tech talent in the United States, home to the state capital, and the University of Wisconsin. Madison has received accolades for being the greenest city in America (NerdWallet), the best city for renters (SmartAsset), the fittest city in America (Fitbit), and it has the highest concentration of millennial talent in the country (Inc.).More than just important work.We offer comprehensive benefits to keep you healthy and happy as you grow in your life and career, and your merit-based compensation will reflect the impact your work has on the company and our customers. You'll also be eligible for annual raises and bonuses, as well as stock grants, which give you an even greater stake in the success of Epic and our customers. Epic is an Equal Opportunity employer. We seek diverse perspectives, backgrounds, and experiences in our mission to improve healthcare. Research has shown that job-seekers who are women, LGBTQ+, or members of the global majority are less likely to apply for roles they don't seem completely qualified for, so we encourage all who are interested to apply. Please see our full non-discrimination statement at https //careers.epic.com/EEO.Bachelor's degree or greaterA history of academic excellence or professional successWillingness to travel occasionally to customer locationsEligible to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorshipRelocation to the Madison, WI area (reimbursed)COVID-19 vaccination
Industries: Software Development, Hospitals and Health Care, and Information Technology & Services

title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
job_description: Company Description KRAMBU INC. is an independent provider/advisor of enterprise compute solutions based in Coeur d'Alene, ID. Our mission is to provide accessible, performance-driven solutions in the form of innovative high-performance compute. We are dedicated to delivering cutting-edge technology solutions to our clients. Role Description This is a contract Artificial Intelligence Engineer role. As an Artificial Intelligence Engineer at KRAMBU INC., you will be responsible for developing and implementing AI solutions and algorithms. Your day-to-day tasks will include pattern recognition, software development, and utilizing neural networks and natural language processing (NLP) techniques. This is a hybrid role, based in Coeur d'Alene, ID, with flexibility for some remote work. Qualifications Strong background in Computer Science and Software DevelopmentExperience in pattern recognition and neural networksProficiency in Natural Language Processing (NLP)Ability to develop and implement AI solutionsExcellent problem-solving and analytical skillsAbility to work independently and in a team environmentStrong communication and collaboration skillsMaster's or Ph.D. in a related field (preferred)Experience with machine learning frameworks and libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) is a plus

title: Embedded Systems Application Engineer
job_description: We are seeking a highly energetic and passionate individual capable of taking on the technical leadership in the USA. The role involves taking ownership of Blaxtair technology in order to perform product management and OEM business development for the North American Market. As Application Engineer, you engage daily with the Technical, Product Management, and OEM Sales teams as well as with the sales and technical teams of customers. These interactions involve people across Europe and North America. Application Engineer Responsibilities (subject to develop over time)Technical Leadership:You oversee training of the entire technical team in the U.S. (installation, repairs, customer support, integration support, maintenance). You are the technical reference for the entire team in North America, including for existing and new features of our products. You contribute to the production of technical documentation in English in the scope of your responsibilities, for internal and external use. You may also contribute to easing the relationship with U.S. laboratories in order to develop research partnerships with Arcure.Product Management:You support the product manager in Europe to understand the North American market, including interviewing customers, partaking in internal sales, gathering user and installer needs, and structuring feedback to the product manager.You provide customer feedback and propose product improvements to estimate the potential size of new business brought by these improvements.You are in permanent contact with the product manager and development team in Europe to understand the technology, roadmap, and potential impacts of customer requests on product design and performance.You contribute to the management and coordination of new product and feature launches in North America, potentially interfacing with all departments of the Group.OEM Business Development:Arcure is quickly expanding in the Global AI Market and Smart Perception for Off-Road Vehicles. Off-Road Vehicle Manufacturers (OEM) in North America are a key component to our growth strategy. In the scope of Arcure development, the relationships with North American forklifts and construction equipment manufacturers are being developed. As the North American product expert and main technical contact to local OEMs you will:Make technical presentations at OEM facilities to support the local sales teams.Discuss the integration and interfaces between Blaxtair products and OEM machines, supporting European-based product management, OEM business development, and the research and development team.   Qualifications/SkillsAutonomous, self-confident, proactiveStructured, rigorous, analytical, technically curious, organized, ability to multitask Dynamic, pragmatic, able to identify drivers of problems, problem-solver attitudeAbility to take ownership of the entire scope of technical lead for the USAbility to develop product and company knowledgeProfessional, skilled presenter and public speaker, ability to develop client relationshipsNegotiation, ambition to take responsibilities in a growing companyEmpathy, good listening skillsTeam culture approach, intercultural experience or skills, taste for European culture Education and ExperienceMinimum Education: Bachelor of Science in Computer and Electrical Engineering2 years of experience in project or product management or product in the field of embedded systemsForeign language (French) a plusAI or Edge Computing experience a plus Job Location / TypeLocated in Boise (ID)Part-time remote work is possible for this positionFull-time exempt Benefits401(K), Health/Dental/Vision, Disability, and Life InsurancePaid time off (15 days PTO + 1 additional PTO every year up to 20, 5 Holidays, 5 sick days) CompensationBase: according to experience and skillsPerformance bonus is paid twice per year Travel RequirementMostly in the U.S. Some Foreign trips to be expected several times per year. Recruiting processInterviews with Program Manager and CEOShort test may be administeredTwo references required

title: Analyst II, Backbook Credit Risk
job_description: Affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly, giving consumers the flexibility to buy now and pay later without any hidden fees or compounding interest.The Backbook Risk team is responsible for Affirm’s backbook strategy, forecasting and performance monitoring globally. The team works cross-functionally with Credit Risk, Compliance, Machine Learning, Product, Engineering, Operations, Growth Analytics, and Finance teams to define and ensure execution of the Backbook Risk strategy to assert adherence to the Risk Appetite.This role requires extensive use of data analytics to derive insights and develop risk strategies, collaborating with cross-functional partners to manage the company’s backbook and improve customer repayments. The full stack senior analyst will work with the Product team to develop new products and features, with the Machine Learning and Engineering team to develop new forecasting models and risk management capabilities, and with the Resolutions team to execute risk and resolution strategiesCome join us in our mission to change consumer finance through better data and technology, lower costs, and increased transparency while providing the best customer experience.What You Will Do In collaboration with Machine Learning, Credit Risk, Growth Analytics and Finance teams, develop and continually refine initiatives to improve the performance of the backbook Perform rigorous quantitative analysis to monitor the efficiency of launched initiatives, including measuring impact to the company’s profitability; draft analytical experiment plans to be used for A/B testing of new initiatives in the repayments space. Own end-to-end risk analytical workflow to support data-driven decisions and customer impact initiatives for repayments and collections. Support and enhance repayments efforts through technical analysis; this includes reviewing and revising KPIs that track the performance of ongoing efforts, developing and maintaining forecasting models, designing experiments for A/B testing of various initiatives, and working cross-functionally to formulate strategy Solve interesting credit and user segmentation challenges with alternative data and advanced analytics. Enhance backbook and repayments tracking & strategy for Affirm’s growing international presence; set up and monitor KPIs and devise strategies for different markets based on analytical insightsWhat We Look For Passion to redefine the lending and financial industry for the better 3-5 years of work experience in risk analytics and/or modeling role within Fintech/Banking Proficient in SQL, experience with Python and data visualization tools Proven understanding of risk fundamentals (experience with both consumer and business risk management practices, an understanding of industry risk trends) Ability to communicate findings and recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences Experience in statistical modeling in a professional setting preferred Bachelor’s or graduate degree in a quantitatively rigorous subject area like engineering, statistics, math, finance, economics, computer science Intelligence + Humility. Hubris is the fastest way to blow up a business!Pay Grade - CAN29Employees new to Affirm or promoted into a new role, typically begin in the min to mid range.CAN Base Pay Range Per YearMin: $105,300Mid: $131,600Max: $157,900Affirm is proud to be a remote-first company! The majority of our roles are remote and you can work almost anywhere within the country of employment. Affirmers in proximal roles have the flexibility to work remotely, but will occasionally be required to work out of their assigned Affirm office. A limited number of roles remain office-based due to the nature of their job responsibilities.BenefitsWe’re extremely proud to offer competitive benefits that are anchored to our core value of people come first. Some key highlights of our benefits package include: Health care coverage - Affirm covers all premiums for all levels of coverage for you and your dependents  Flexible Spending Wallets - generous stipends for spending on Technology, Food, various Lifestyle needs, and family forming expenses  Time off - competitive vacation and holiday schedules allowing you to take time off to rest and recharge  ESPP - An employee stock purchase plan enabling you to buy shares of Affirm at a discount We believe It’s On Us to provide an inclusive interview experience for all, including people with disabilities. We are happy to provide reasonable accommodations to candidates in need of individualized support during the hiring process.[For U.S. positions that could be performed in Los Angeles or San Francisco] Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance and Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance, Affirm will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.By clicking "Submit Application," you acknowledge that you have read the Affirm Employment Privacy Policy for applicants within the United States, the EU Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data (Poland) for applicants applying from Poland, the EU Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data (Spain) for applicants applying from Spain, or the Affirm U.K. Limited Employee Notice Regarding Use of Personal Data for applicants applying from the United Kingdom, and hereby freely and unambiguously give informed consent to the collection, processing, use, and storage of your personal information as described therein.

title: Data Pipeline Engineer (Top Secret Clearance)
job_description: Job DescriptionData Pipeline EngineerClearance Requirement:TSLocation:Washington D.C. or NYCOnsite Requirement:5 Days/week onsiteThe RoleData Pipeline engineers ensure that our customers work with updated and accurate data in Foundry. You are the first to respond to data health failures on key pipelines. You are technical, with a passion for system support. You are comfortable reading code to identify fixes and making changes to improve the performance and stability of production data pipelines. Working alongside pipeline engineers from other customer accounts, your insights into the product and process will form an essential part of feedback to our product engineering team, and other user and product support teams.Core ResponsibilitiesMaintaining and building schedules so that pipelines run.Setting up and maintaining health checks on different pipelines.Responding to, triaging, and debugging pipelines when there is a problem (usually this is when health checks fail). This will include limited out of hours support for critical issues (e.g. a critical subset of alerts can page you overnight or during the weekend*).Reading code and writing code changes and/or modifying the monitoring set-up where necessary.Knowing and understanding how to navigate the pipelines and documentation.Following SOPs to contact other teams and data providers when data is incorrect or not received on time.Communicating outages with the end users of a pipeline.Contributing to and monitoring tooling improvements (where feasible).Active work not required on weekends or out of hours, however due to the nature of on-call, the person must be available to respond if there is a critical outage during their assigned on-call weeks. After an on-call weekend the engineer will receive 2 days off.What We RequireTS clearance or higher. Qualifications: What We ValueComfortable reading and writing code in SQL, Python, Pyspark and Java.Basic understanding of Spark and familiar/interested in learning the basics of tuning Spark jobs.Practical experience with performing root cause analysis and documenting lessons learned from production incidents (e.g. creating post-mortem reports).Ability to work within an agile team.Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to skillfully engage with customers on complex, sensitive topics.Strong organizational skills and attention to detail through effective prioritization. Why is This a Great Opportunity: Great salariesLots of upward mobility401K, Sign On Bonuses, Tuition Reimbursements, Covered HealthcareSalary Type : Annual SalarySalary Min : 160000Salary Max : 200000Currency Type : US Dollars]]>

title: Embedded Systems Engineer
job_description: Job Overview:Bastian Solutions R&D is a driven team of innovators with a passion for rapid product development and continuous improvement. We combine the technical excellence of our people with the company's industry experience to bring new ideas to life and create value for our customers. Together, we enable Bastian Solutions to provide our clients with world-class distribution and production solutions. The Embedded Systems Engineer III will work with a small state-of-the-art R&D team in Boise to bring new ideas to life that will help transform the material handling industry. They will utilize the latest technologies to integrate robotics into material handling systems for complex applications. This includes R&D and prototype development to successfully bring new products to market. The process involves understanding the customer's goals and objectives and developing engineered solutions to meet these goals. Job Functions:Collaborate with Electrical, Mechanical and Software Engineering teams to come up with innovating new ideas and new technologiesDesign architectures and schematics for successful embedded systems and robotics projects with regards to system functionality, customer satisfaction, schedule, time, and budgetWork with layout engineer to design PCB layouts Work with contract manufacturers to produce PCBs for prototype and/or production quantitiesDetail and perform PCB testing to ensure hardware meets design requirementsMentor junior engineers in the PCB design processWilling to take on robotic system electrical design challengesSpecify and select parts, evaluate their operation, and integrate them into the hardware designDocument functional specifications to support embedded systems projectsProvide input on schedule and plan that maintain JIRA project while communicating it with managersRemain up to date on all industry trends and new research in order help train and develop team members Cross collaboration outside of discipline to come up with innovating new ideas and new technologies Introduce and present new technology concepts to the teamTrack projects and report progress and issues to the engineering managerAssist in resolving engineering issues as they arise by working closely with the engineering team, vendors, and the shop Ensure we meet and exceed our customer's expectations through superior design and implementation Complete all administrative tasks/paperwork in timely manner Ability to prioritize individual tasks on your own based while understanding project priorities from a macro levelAttend training and become certified in applicable controls technologies or programsTravel Requirements: 25% overnight travel (Travel expenses paid by Bastian Solutions)Preferred Skills and Qualifications5-8 years’ experience in a firmware engineer or embedded systems engineer position or equivalent positionMinimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science/Engineering, or related fieldPCB schematic and layout design experience through Altium or related softwareSerial digital communication knowledge (UART, I2C, CAN, SPI, USB)Test equipment (Oscilloscope, Multimeter, signal analyzers)Experience in C/C++, Python, and other common development languagesReal-Time Operating System (RTOS)Experience driving agile process for project pacingNeed demonstrated project management and time tracking management Driving the team to learn and research new projects and technology Background in a title: 35N Signals Intelligence Analyst
job_description: The Army National Guard uses powerful technology to collect information from foreign signals, and it's the Signals Intelligence Analyst who makes it possible for the Guard to use this information to their advantage.Analyzing foreign communications helps our military experts better plan our Nation's defense. As a Signals Intelligence Analyst, you will intercept and analyze foreign communications; relay intelligence reports regarding combat, strategic, and tactical intelligence information; and study and locate radio signals to understand the tactics and organization of foreign military forces.Job Duties Maintain analytical working aids and databases Assist in the emplacement, camouflage, and recovery of surveillance systems Prepare technical and tactical intelligence reportsSome Of The Skills You’ll Learn Analyzing communications information using technical references Preparing technical and tactical intelligence reportsHelpful Skills Interest in working with radio equipment Enjoy finding clues that help answer questions Ability to remain alert doing repetitive tasksThrough your training, you will develop the skills and experience to enjoy a civilian career with government agencies like the NSA, the FBI, and the CIA, or other companies in private electronics and communicationcompanies.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to train. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance.Job training for a Signals Intelligence Analyst consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you’ll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 18 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT), which includes practice in operating radio equipment.
Industries: Government Relations Services, International Affairs, and Security and Investigations
